item.title: March Madness model bracket results
item.description: Now that this year’s tournament has officially come to an end, I am reflecting on how the bracket I filled out using data analysis turned out. Overall, the model did a pretty solid job. It correctly picked 41 out of 63 total tournament games, achieving 1130 out of a possible 1920 points. That may not sound great, but with all the upsets that occurred this year, the 1130 points put the bracket in the 94th percentile and a 916,000 rank on ESPN, out of around 15 million total brackets.

item.title: Combining basketball IQ & data analysis to fill out a March Madness bracket
item.description: This is how I filled out my 2021 March Madness bracket combining my own college basketball knowledge with a model I made using data analysis. To begin, I used the programming language R and loaded up 3 useful libraries.
